Passage: Using the X-ray technology of the European Synchrotron radiation Accelerator, the researchers scanned a fossil of a true-footed snake hidden in an ancient rock dating back 9500 million years. It turns out that this snake is very similar to modern terrestrial lizards, which helps to unravel the mystery of the origin of snakes. The research report points out that the snake is 50 centimeters long. On the surface, it has only one foot, about 2 centimeters long. The other foot of the real foot snake was found by X-ray scanning. The reason why this foot is not easy to detect is that it was alienated in the rock, with only four bones in its ankle and no toes, indicating that the feet of true-footed snakes had deteriorated at that time.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can best support the views of the above scholars?

B. B.The true-footed snake lived at a time when snakes evolved from a legged animal to non-footed animal.
C. C.The true-footed snake lived at a time when snakes degenerated from non-footed animal to a legged lizard.
D. D.The age of this true-footed snake coincides with the period when snakes degenerated from a legged animal to a non-footed animal.
Answer:

data.sampled:
The statement "it was previously thought that human evolution took place about 800 million years ago" falsely implies that this finding contradicts previous knowledge. This statement is not supported by the scientific evidence presented in the passage.
The finding of fossilized bacteria in Scottish rocks that might have lived about 1.2 billion years ago supports the idea that the concentration of oxygen on Earth has increased to the level necessary for human evolution. This major event took place 1.2 billion years ago and it was 400 million years earlier than scientists previously thought. The new research is expected to give scientists a new understanding of the timetable for the evolution of the Earth's atmosphere and the life that depends on it for a living.
The statement "only the concentration of oxygen in the atmosphere increases to a critical point can some bacteria survive" is not supported by the scientific evidence presented in the passage. The research suggests that the oxygen level in the atmosphere has increased to a critical point and that other factors, such as the availability of water and nutrients, also play a role in the survival of bacteria.

data.sampled:
Based on the information provided in the passage, we can infer that(B) is the best way to support the findings.

When considered alongside the second sentence in the passage, which states that the proportion of only children among those who have won votes is roughly the same as their proportion in the survey, we can see that the claim in the first sentence that "among those who received five votes, the proportion of only children was consistent with the proportion of their population in this age group" is unsupported by the data provided in the passage.

In other words, while the proportion of only children is certainly higher among those who have won votes than it is among the general population, the difference is not significant, as is required to support the conclusion in the second sentence that there is no significant difference in social skills between only children and non-only children.

Instead, the data in the passage show that the proportion of only children among those who have won votes is roughly the same as the proportion of only children among the general population, and this is all that the passage provides to support the claim made in the first sentence.

Consequently, the best inference that can be drawn from the information in the passage is that the difference in social skills between only children and non-only children is not significant, as is required to support the finding in the second sentence.

If the first option is right, you generate the answer 'A', if the second option is right, you generate the answer 'B', if the third option is right, you generate the answer 'C', if the fourth option is right, you generate the answer 'D'. Read the question and options thoroughly and select the correct answer from the four answer labels. Read the passage thoroughly to ensure you know what the passage entails.

Passage: Faith is the foundation of morality. Morality without faith is water without a source and a tree without roots. People without faith have no moral bottom line; and once a person has no moral bottom line, then the law is not binding on him. Law, morality and faith are the basic guarantee of the harmonious operation of the society, and faith is the cornerstone of the harmonious operation of the society.Question: According to the above statement, which of the followings can be inferred?
A. A.Morality is one of the cornerstones of the harmonious operation of society.
B. B.If a person has faith, the law is binding on him.
C. C.Only when the society operates harmoniously can the foundation of morality and belief come into being.
D. D.The law is binding only on people of faith.
Answer:

data.sampled:
According to the passage, if any of the following statements are true, they would best refute the argument:

A. A.The ethnic minorities in the south may have been the northerners who migrated to the south a long time ago.

If the ethnic minorities in the south were the northerners who migrated to the south a long time ago, this would suggest that the Han nationality in the north and south are not descended from the same ancestors, which contradicts the argument made in the text.

B. B.Feudal emperors once sealed some of the ethnic minorities with the surnames of emperors.

If feudal emperors once sealed some of the ethnic minorities with the surnames of emperors, this would suggest that the surnames of these emperors were not widespread and did not represent the ethnic makeup of the territories they controlled, which would also contradict the argument made in the text.

C. C.The north and south branches with the same surname may not come from the same ancestor.

If the north and south branches with the same surname may not come from the same ancestor, this would suggest that the Chinese surname is not a straightforward descendent of an ancient nomadic tribe or other group of people, which contradicts the argument made in the text.

D. D.In history, there have also been cases in which ethnic minorities moved northward.

If in history, there have also been cases in which ethnic minorities moved northward, this would suggest that the argument made in the text is not inherently flawed, but rather that it may reflect a particular historical situation, which would not necessarily falsify the argument.

Read the question and options thoroughly and select the correct answer from the four answer labels. Read the passage thoroughly to ensure you know what the passage entails.

Passage: The Chinese surname has a very big characteristic, that is, it is the same Han surname, but it is likely to have a very big difference in consanguinity. Generally speaking, taking Wuyishan-Nanling as the boundary, the consanguinity of Chinese surnames is obviously divided into two branches: the north and the south.The consanguinity of the Han nationality between the two places is quite different, even greater than that between the Han nationality in the north and south and the local ethnic minorities. This shows that with the expansion of the population, the Han nationality continued to go south and crossed the Yangtze River into Huguang more than 2000 years ago, and finally crossed the strait to Hainan Island. During this process, the Han people who moved south continued to integrate with many ethnic minorities who spoke Dong-Tai, South Asian and Miao languages, thus diluting the consanguinity of the Han nationality in the north.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can best refute the above argument?
A. A.The ethnic minorities in the south may have been the northerners who migrated to the south a long time ago.
B. B.Feudal emperors once sealed some of the ethnic minorities with the surnames of emperors.
C. C.The north and south branches with the same surname may not come from the same ancestor.
D. D.In history, there have also been cases in which ethnic minorities moved northward.
Answer:

data.sampled:
Based on the information provided, it is possible to properly point out the problems in Dr. Zhang's analysis as follows:

A. A. The period of the publishing of the newspaper and the reading time of the reader may be different. If this is true, it could indicate that the readers prefer to read the paper later in the day or at night, when they are more likely to have free time to do so. Additionally, the morning paper may not be as relevant or attractive to readers as the other papers, which could negatively impact its circulation and advertising revenue.

B. B. The lights in bars or cinemas are too dim to read newspapers. If this is true, it could prevent many people from reading the newspapers, especially in darker areas or at night. Additionally, the readers may struggle to read the headlines and small print of the news articles, which could make the paper harder to navigate and understand.

C. C. Many people have the habit of reading before going to bed, but few read newspapers. If this is true, it could indicate that many readers prefer to read other types of content, such as books or magazines, before bed. Additionally, the lack of newspaper reading could reduce the amount of news that is learned and digested by readers, which could affect their understanding of current events.

D. D. In the evening, people are used to watching TV programs and are less likely to read newspapers. If this is true, it could prevent many people from reading newspapers during their evening hours, which could reduce the paper's circulation and advertising revenue. Additionally, the fact that the readers are used to watching TV during their free time could make the paper seem outdated or irrelevant compared to other sources of news.

Passage: The newspaper group of a certain city encountered difficulties in operation and went to a consulting company for assistance. The consulting company sent Dr. Zhang to investigate the period of the publishing of the target newspaper. There is a morning paper in the morning, a daily newspaper in the morning and an evening paper in the afternoon, all of which are not prepared for night. Dr. Zhang suggested that they should set up a "Metropolitan Night News" to occupy this market.Question: Which of the followings, if true, can properly point out the problems in Dr. Zhang's analysis?
A. A.The period of the publishing of the newspaper and the reading time of the reader may be different.
B. B.The lights in bars or cinemas are too dim to read newspapers.
C. C.Many people have the habit of reading before going to bed, but few read newspapers.
D. D.In the evening, people are used to watching TV programs and seldom read newspapers.
Answer:

Passage: On the morning of November 8, the State Administration of Science, Technology and Industry for National Defense released for the first time a local image of the lunar Hongwan area, the pre-selected landing area of Chang'e-3, sent back by the Chang'e-2 satellite. It is a black-and-white image taken at 18:00 on October 28th and captured by a satellite about 18.7km from the moon's surface. The return of the camera indicates that the goals of the six projects set by the Chang'e-2 mission have all been achieved, which means that the Chang'e-2 project has been a complete success. The return of the camera indicates that the goals of the six projects set by the Chang'e-2 mission have all been achieved, which means that the Chang'e-2 project has been a complete success. The return of the camera indicates that the goals of the six projects set by the Chang'e-2 mission have all been achieved, which means that the Chang'e-2 project has been a complete success. It is understood that in the future, there will also be a CCD camera on the Chang'e-3 lander. At that time, it will not only take pictures, but also independently avoid the places where the lander is not suitable for landing during the soft landing, and the "immediate decision" will choose a flat surface suitable for landing for the lander.Question: Which of the following options can not be inferred from the main question?
A. A.The resolution of the CCD camera carried by Chang'e-2 is higher than that carried by Chang'e-1.
B. B.In the future, the CCD camera carried by Chang'e-3 will be more powerful than that carried by Chang'e-2.
C. C.Chang'e-2 has made a precise choice for the landing site of the Chang'e-3 satellite to be launched in the future.
D. D.The lander of Chang'e-3 should choose a flat surface during the soft landing of the moon.
Answer:
